intro: Stelligera endecaspinis, commonly known as the nine-spined stellaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its unique floral structure and historical use in traditional medicine contribute to its ecological and botanical significance.
